cab.content: Military Secret. 1054 ,From Viceroy, Army Department, to Secretary of State for India,19th August 1919.(Received 21st.)11257. 19th August 1919. Gist of letter to Malleson from Bokhara, dated 3rd August, is that Bokhara is quiet; Amir is polite to Bolsheviks. Civil population detest, and Mullahs frequently denounce, them. Their position in Tashkent is considered critical; there is little law and order in Tashkent area. Kazim Beg passed through Bokhara about 12th July and made great efforts to persuade Amir to join Afghans in Jehad, but was dismissed without comment.
